urls.title: Flood Alert, Flood Warning and Severe Flood Warning ‚Äì What‚Äôs the difference? | Newground
urls.description: Recently, I saw a poll on Twitter set up to help the Environment Agency understand people‚Äôs interpretation of flood risk, which is one of the reasons I decided to write this blog. Out of the 1,199 people who voted on the poll, I was quite shocked to find that 51% of voters thought a Flood Alert meant that you were at a higher risk of flooding than a Flood Warning. This is NOT the case. Raising awareness of the flood alerts and warning system and what each stage means is key to educating people and

urls.title: Environment Agency silent on removal of pollution goal from performance report

urls.title: Education & Learning Packs - Unlocking the Severn
urls.description: Education packs to introduce learners to the world of water and rivers. From the wonderful water cycle to river friendly farming, engineering a fish pass to designing your own river! For teachers and home-schoolers, these are jam packed with engaging activities and dotted with fun facts to keep children engaged.

urls.title: How to help us count shad - Unlocking the Severn
urls.description: Help us monitor the annual shad migration by counting the number of fish successful swimming upstream at the notch in Upper Lode weir. We need the help and support of members of the public to help us monitor the rare twaite shad during their annual migration on the River Severn. So, if you have a few minutes to spare, please help us count shad and become a citizen scientist! The visual count by citizen scientists is an important part of our monitoring programme. It provides data and helps calibrate other

tweets.text:
Kids and adults you can help @severnunlocked by doing some   #citizenscience by watching some video footage of a fish pass and counting the number of fish that make it over https://t.co/HUV3J69haH

urls.description: We use some essential cookies to make this website work. tweets.text:
Today @EnvAgency launches its 10 yr monitoring report into #ClimateEmergency related changes to the #Thames Estuary. By incorporating findings to the @TE2100Plan we are adapting to a more #ClimateResilient future. #TogetherForOurPlanet #RaceToResilience
